questions.question_text: You can set a default value for a custom field.

discussion.content:
In here: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.workflow_rules_considerations.htm&type=5 
it says: "The order that individual actions and types of actions are executed in isnâ€™t guaranteed. Field update actions are executed first, followed by other actions."
Based on this, A and B can be equally correct, can't it?

The question is bizarre, to say the least

Selected Answer: B
B specifies the 4 actions in a Workflow Rule but not in the right order
1. Email Alert 
2. Field Update 
3. Tasks 
4. Outbound Message

Selected Answer: C
https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000383414&type=1
B specifies the 4 actions in a Workflow Rule :
1. Email Alert
2. Field Update
3. Tasks
4. Outbound Message

choices.B: Field Updates, Tasks, Email Alerts, Outbound Messages
choices.C: Apex before Triggers, Apex after Triggers, Workflow Rules
choices.D: Email Alerts, Outbound Messages, Field updates
choices.A: Field Updates, Outbound Messages, Email Alerts, Tasks

questions.question_text: Select the order in which the Workflow actions fire in Salesforce.
Which of the following is an example of One-to-Many Relationships between Standard objects?

choices.E: True. If Object permission is disabled.
choices.D: False. If Object permission is disabled.
choices.C: True. If Object permission is enabled.
choices.F: False. If Object permission is enabled.
